name: NOVLDMSG
description: Normally in the ENTER command if the vld option is set and the expression returns .F., a vldm (valid message) is displayed, or if you have not provided one, a generalized message is displayed. In certain instances you might have multiple valid messages depending on other circumstances. In that situation you can display the appropriate message in the vld check itself and by using this command, a generalized message will not be displayed when the program returns to the ENTER command.
comments: Normally in the ENTER command if the vld option is set and the expression returns .F., a vldm (valid message) is displayed, or if you have not provided one, a generalized message is displayed.
